title: Farming of Cervid Livestock: A Look into Management of the Animal and its Waste

tasks.task: Describe the management considerations and manure characteristics of deer and other cervid livestock.
subtasks: Understand the varying management approaches for deer, elk, fallow deer, and red deer.
Visualize the physical layout of a deer farm compared to traditional livestock operations.
Explain the economic aspects of raising deer and other cervids.
Differentiate between browsers and grazers in terms of land use.
Compare manure characteristics between red deer/elk and whitetail deer.
Consider the impact of manure digestibility on nutrient content and management.

tasks.task: Reflect on the influence of dietary factors on manure characteristics.
